message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NA, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the analysis of codes used in distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the use of array codes and their potential to reduce repair bandwidth, which is a topic related to data structures (cs.DS) and systems and control (cs.SI). The paper introduces new methods of analysis that involve geometric problems on operators and subspaces, which is a topic related to numerical analysis (cs.NA). Finally, the paper provides a new bound on the sub-packetization factor required for optimal fraction, which is a topic related to complexity theory (cs.CC).
